page.title: 01The hills of Ewes
page.content: The blocks landscape is of hills. The hills are rolling upland ground. Not much rocky hill area. The higest point is Crumpton hill which is marked with a triangulation pillar standing 480 metres above sealevel. the lowest point is the Great Hill of 437 metres above sea level. On the tops of the hills there is a covering of heather bags. bracken has claimed the foot of these hills. Sykes and small streams canbe seen frequently and is characteristic f this are. The nly local inhabitants are hseep whichare left to roam freely. There is there presence of forestry at the side of Crumpton Hill which is dominated by conifers.
